title: etherscan verify complains about missing licence information
body:
### Version of Hardhat

2.14.0, 2.15.0

### What happened?

after deploying a contract with hardhat I started the verify task.
It fails with the error 
```
no license speccified in the source code for Vault (contracts/core/Vault.sol:Vault), Please use option --license <SPDX>
```
I was able to verify the contract with `npx cross-env NETWORK="sepolia" hardhat --network sepolia etherscan-verify --license MIT --solc-input` but this is no permanent solution
If you look up the contract on sepolia testnet https://sepolia.etherscan.io/address/0x49604f3222A8c533700A9670efB9Cc00BC634FFf#code
you can clearly see that the licence is indeed defined on line one of the contract despite what the verify task is claiming.

This has to be some strange condition. the deploy task deploys a bunch of contracts (>20) and this is the only one giving this error.

In addition other contracts got verified correctly but output states `already verified: USDG (0xAC9ba14917e4fe86D2238E4370D3779A097ffB26), skipping.`
Which can not be true on the first run of verification.
This happens if I change Vault.sol a bit and restart the deploy script and try to verify afterwards.
Since Vault.sol address is a constructor parameter of USDG.sol it got deployed too but it seems that somehow it got verfied without me doing it explicitly. However etherscan state that the contract is indeed verified. I confirmed that as soon as the contract is deployed it is verified. So this might not be a hardhat thing but some etherscan magic.

### Minimal reproduction steps

Deploy the contract with "// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT" in the fist line of code
Try to verify the contract

### Search terms

verify SPDX-License-Identifier contract publish
